element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm creates a continuous raster layer from a set of points, using the kriging interpolation method.

element.name: FIELD
element.text: The field that contains the value to use for interpolation.

element.name: DIST
element.text: The distance within which points are analized, in map units. Only those points within the search radius from a given cell are used to compute the value at that cell

element.name: MINPOINTS
element.text: The minimum number of points needed for inteprolation. If the number of points within the search radius of a cell is lower than this number, the cell will be assigned the no-data value

element.name: MODEL
element.text: The semivariogram model to use: * Spherical * Exponential * Gaussian

element.name: NUGGET
element.text: The nugget value of the variogram

element.name: SILL
element.text: The sill value of the variogram

element.name: RANGE
element.text: The range value of the variogram

element.name: CROSSVALIDATION
element.text: Cross validation table. This is calculated interpolating at the corrdinates of the input points, using all the points except the one at that coordinate. Expected values and values obtained from interpolation are then compared to evaluate the correctness of the model, which is summarized in this table.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: The resulting raster layer with values interpolated from the input points.
